name: VCO - Pulsar
description: This algorithm is based on the Pulsar VCO algorithm from the disting mk4 and implements pulsar synthesis, inspired by Curtis Roads's book *Microsound* (MIT Press) pp137-157. In pulsar synthesis, a small grain of sound (known as a *pulsaret*, typically a pulse or single cycle waveform) is repeated periodically, followed by silence. The length of the sound within the repeating period controls timbre without affecting perceived pitch. Changing fundamental pitch while keeping pulsaret speed constant achieves pitch shifts without spectral transposition, resembling 'vocal' or 'formant' synthesis. Two pitch inputs exist: fundamental frequency (rate of pulsaret train generation) and formant frequency (speed at which the pulsaret is played). If 'Pitch mode' is set to 'Independent', these pitches are separate; if set to 'Tracking', changing fundamental pitch also alters formant pitch. The algorithm uses wavetables from an SD card as the source for pulsarets, formatted as described in the MicroSD section above.
use_cases: Pulsar synthesis for unique timbre control without pitch shift artifacts
Formant-like sound manipulation with independent pitch and speed parameters
Generating vocal or formant synthesis effects through CV modulation
Wavetable-based granular synthesis with masking capabilities
gui_description: The display shows a single cycle of the current waveform, along with the VCOâ€™s pitch as a MIDI note name plus cents and frequency in Hz. The wavetable waveform is visually stretched or expanded based on the relative pitch between the VCO and formant.

input_ports.name: Pitch input
input_ports.description: The pitch CV input (1V/octave) for setting the fundamental frequency of the VCO.

input_ports.name: Formant input
input_ports.description: The formant CV input (1V/octave) for setting the rate at which pulsarets are played, affecting timbre.

input_ports.name: Wave input
input_ports.description: Sets an input bus to modulate the wave offset within the wavetable.

output_ports.name: Output
output_ports.description: The main output bus for the VCO signal, with masking applied according to the selected mode.

output_ports.name: Inverse output
output_ports.description: Emits a pulsaret when the main output does not, providing an alternative masked signal path.
